general.theme.title: Theme
general.language.title: Language
general.language.description: Choose the display language for the app.
general.startup.title: Startup
general.startup.description: Control how Vox launches on your system.
general.startup.devDisabled: Disabled in development mode. This feature works only in the production build.
general.startup.autoStart: Automatically start Vox when you log in to your computer
general.hud.title: HUD
general.hud.description: Floating widget for one-click recording and status display.
general.hud.banner.title: Enable the always-on HUD
general.hud.banner.description: Keep a small floating button on your screen at all times. Click it to start recording instantly — the HUD already appears during recording, this keeps it visible so you never have to search for it.
general.hud.showHudDesc: Keep the HUD visible as a circle on screen. When recording starts, it morphs into a status pill.
general.hud.showOnHoverDesc: Shrink the HUD when the cursor is far away and grow it as you move closer.
general.hud.showActionsOnHoverDesc: Show settings, transcriptions, and hide buttons when hovering the HUD.
general.hud.positionDesc: Choose where the HUD appears on screen.
general.preview.title: This is how you'd see it:
general.preview.dragHint: You can also drag it here
general.about.title: About
general.about.readyToInstall: Vox v{version} is ready to install
whisper.title: Local Model
whisper.description: Select the local speech recognition model. Larger models are more accurate but slower.
whisper.downloadPrompt: Please download a model below to get started
whisper.testHint: Records 5 seconds of audio and transcribes it using the selected local model. Local models run entirely on your device, ensuring your audio never leaves your computer for maximum privacy.
whisper.model.tiny.label: Fastest
whisper.model.base.label: Fast
whisper.model.small.label: Balanced
whisper.model.medium.label: Accurate
whisper.model.large.label: Best
llm.title: AI Enhancement
llm.description: Enhance your transcriptions by automatically fixing grammar, removing filler words, and cleaning up your speech.
llm.setupDescription: Improve your transcriptions by automatically fixing grammar, removing filler words, and cleaning up your speech.
llm.enableHint: When off, you'll get the raw Whisper transcription. When on, AI will enhance your text by fixing grammar and removing filler words.
llm.connectionTestRequired: You need to test the connection before AI enhancement can be used
llm.customInstructionsHint: Your custom instructions will be added on top of Vox's default behavior (fix grammar, remove filler words, preserve meaning). Leave empty to use only the defaults.
llm.customInstructionsPlaceholder: Add additional instructions for the AI...
llm.bedrock.profileHint: Optional. Named profile from ~/.aws/credentials. Ignored when Access Key ID is provided.
llm.bedrock.accessKeyPlaceholder: Leave empty to use default credentials
llm.bedrock.accessKeyHint: Optional. If empty, uses AWS default credential chain (env vars, ~/.aws/credentials, IAM roles).
llm.custom.label: Custom
llm.custom.endpointHint: Full URL of your API endpoint (e.g., https://my-api.example.com/v1/chat/completions).
llm.custom.tokenPlaceholder: Enter your API token or key
llm.custom.modelHint: Optional. If your API requires a model parameter.
llm.openai.endpointHint: Pre-filled for {provider}. Change only if using a custom endpoint.
llm.litellm.endpointHint: URL of your LiteLLM proxy instance (e.g., http://localhost:4000).
llm.litellm.apiKeyPlaceholder: Optional — depends on your LiteLLM setup
llm.litellm.apiKeyHint: Only required if your LiteLLM proxy is configured with authentication.
llm.litellm.modelHint: LiteLLM uses the format provider/model for provider-specific models: gpt-4o, azure/gpt-4, bedrock/claude-3, anthropic/claude-3-5-sonnet, cohere/command-r-plus.
permissions.title: System Permissions
permissions.description: Vox requires these macOS permissions to function properly.
permissions.keychainDesc: Vox uses the system Keychain to encrypt your API keys and secrets.
permissions.keychainAvailableDesc: Ready to protect your secrets when you add API keys
permissions.keychainUnprotectedDesc: Encryption unavailable — secrets are stored in plaintext. Check your system Keychain settings.
permissions.pipeline.title: Permissions Test
permissions.pipeline.description: Record a short audio sample to verify that microphone and accessibility permissions are working correctly.
shortcuts.title: Keyboard Shortcuts
shortcuts.description: Configure the keyboard shortcuts for voice recording. Click a field and press your desired key combination.
shortcuts.holdHint: Hold to record, release to stop.
shortcuts.toggleHint: Press once to start, press again to stop.
dialog.accessibilityMessage: Vox needs Accessibility permission to use keyboard shortcuts
dialog.accessibilityDetail:
Vox uses global keyboard shortcuts (like Alt+Space) to activate voice recording.

To enable this feature:

1. Click "Open System Settings" below
2. Find and enable "Electron" or "Vox" in the Accessibility list
3. Restart Vox

Without this permission, you can still use Vox from the menu bar, but keyboard shortcuts won't work.
notification.accessibilityRequired.title: Vox - Accessibility Permission Required
notification.accessibilityRequired.body: Please grant Accessibility permission in System Settings to enable keyboard shortcuts.
notification.hookFailed.title: Vox - Keyboard Hook Failed
notification.hookFailed.body: Failed to start keyboard shortcuts. Try restarting Vox.
notification.accessibilityRevoked.title: Vox - Accessibility Permission Revoked
notification.accessibilityRevoked.body: Keyboard shortcuts have been disabled. Re-enable Accessibility permission to restore them.
notification.shortcutsEnabled.title: Vox - Shortcuts Enabled
notification.shortcutsEnabled.body: Accessibility permission granted! Keyboard shortcuts are now active.
notification.restartRequired.title: Vox - Restart Required
notification.restartRequired.body: Please restart Vox for keyboard shortcut changes to take effect.
notification.setupRequired.title: Vox - Setup Required
notification.setupRequired.body: Please configure local model in Settings
notification.pasteFailed: Auto-paste failed: {error}. Text is on your clipboard.
error.noModel: Please configure local model in Settings
history.title: Transcription History
history.noTranscriptions: No transcriptions yet. Start recording to build your history.
history.clipboardHint: Your last transcription is automatically copied to the clipboard.
dictionary.title: Dictionary
dictionary.description: Add words and phrases to improve transcription accuracy for names, technical terms, and jargon.
dictionary.overLimitWarning: Your dictionary has {total} entries but only {fits} fit in the speech recognition prompt. All entries will still be used for AI enhancement.
dictionary.llmRequired: The dictionary requires AI Enhancement to be enabled with a tested connection.
dictionary.hint: Use commas to add multiple terms at once, e.g. "John, Project Alpha, Zoom"
dictionary.emptyState: No entries yet. Add names, places, or any words that are often misheard during transcription.
dictionary.llmRequiredInfo: Dictionary terms are used for AI-enhanced transcription. Enable AI Enhancement to use this feature.
dictionary.speechRequiredInfo: Dictionary requires speech recognition to be configured first.
llm.exampleFunny: "Add humor and make it entertaining while keeping the meaning"
llm.exampleEmojis: "Add relevant emojis throughout the text to make it more expressive"
llm.exampleConcise: "Make it as brief as possible without losing meaning"
general.setup.title: Configure Speech
general.setup.description: Download a speech model to start using Vox for transcription.
general.recordingFeedback.title: Recording Feedback
general.recordingFeedback.description: Play sounds when recording starts and stops.
general.recordingFeedback.audioCue.descr: Play a sound when recording begins to signal you can start speaking.
ui.offlineWarning: You appear to be offline. Some features like model downloads may not work.
general.shortcuts.banner.title: Set up keyboard shortcuts
general.shortcuts.banner.description: Configure hold or toggle shortcuts to start recording from anywhere without clicking.
general.permissions.title: Grant Permissions
general.permissions.description: Vox needs microphone and accessibility permissions to record and paste text.
general.dictionary.title: Improve Accuracy
general.dictionary.description: Add names, technical terms, and jargon to the dictionary to improve transcription accuracy.
general.analytics.title: Analytics
general.analytics.description: Anonymous usage data to help improve Vox.
general.analytics.hint: Help improve Vox by sharing anonymous usage data. No personal information or transcription content is ever collected.
general.performance.title: Performance
general.performance.description: Reduce visual complexity for a lighter experience.
general.performance.reduceAnimationsHint: Disable all CSS transitions and animations throughout the app.
general.performance.reduceVisualEffectsH: Remove shadows, blur, backdrop effects, and gradients for lighter rendering.
onboarding.welcome.title: Welcome to Vox
onboarding.welcome.subtitle: Turn your voice into text, instantly.
onboarding.welcome.description: Speak naturally — Vox transcribes and optionally enhances your words with AI. Let's get you set up.
onboarding.model.title: Speech Model
onboarding.model.privacyNote: Vox uses a local AI model to convert your speech to text. Nothing leaves your computer.
onboarding.permissions.title: Permissions
onboarding.permissions.description: Vox needs a couple of permissions to work:
onboarding.permissions.accessibilityDesc: To use keyboard shortcuts like {shortcut} to start recording
onboarding.permissions.accessibilityOpti: Optional — you can also record from the menu bar icon
onboarding.permissions.denied: Denied — open System Settings to allow
onboarding.permissions.trayNote: You can also record from the menu bar icon without accessibility permission.
onboarding.shortcut.title: How to Record
onboarding.shortcut.customizeHint: You can customize shortcuts later in Settings → Shortcuts
onboarding.tryIt.title: Try Your First Recording
onboarding.tryIt.instruction: Hold {shortcut} and say something, or press the record button.
onboarding.tryIt.suggestedPhrase2: Send me the meeting notes please
onboarding.tryIt.suggestedPhrase3: I'll be there in five minutes
onboarding.tryIt.success: It works! Your transcription has been saved.
onboarding.tryIt.noSpeech: No speech detected. Try again or skip this step.
onboarding.done.title: You're All Set!
onboarding.done.subtitle: Vox is ready to go.
onboarding.done.tip2: Your text appears where your cursor is
onboarding.done.tip3: Check the menu bar icon for options
onboarding.done.aiHint: Want better results? Enable AI Enhancement in Settings → AI Enhancement
onboarding.done.tipTranscriptions: Check the Transcriptions tab for your full searchable history
onboarding.done.tipDictionary: Add names and terms to the Dictionary to improve accuracy
onboarding.done.tipAi: Enable AI Enhancement in Settings to fix grammar automatically
onboarding.rerun.description: Walk through the initial setup steps again.
onboarding.llm.title: AI Enhancement
onboarding.llm.description: Vox can use AI to automatically improve your transcriptions — fixing grammar, removing filler words like "um" and "uh", and cleaning up your text.
onboarding.llm.dictionaryNote: Also enables a custom dictionary for names and terms.
onboarding.llm.optional: This is optional and requires connecting to an AI service. You can set it up anytime in Settings.
onboarding.hud.title: Recording Widget
onboarding.hud.description: Vox has a floating widget (HUD) that shows recording status. You can also enable an always-on button for instant one-click recording.
onboarding.hud.choice.enableDesc: Keep a small floating button on screen. Click it to record instantly.
onboarding.hud.choice.laterDesc: You can enable the HUD anytime in Settings → General.
onboarding.hud.choice.skipDesc: Move on without changing HUD settings.
onboarding.hud.previewLabel: This is how you'll see it:
